bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Summary of Case
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: M.A. Walker recalled: Boat got in pretty close to twelve know was after 11 o'clock as saw clock in enginers room: went straight home after landing from boat: Hary Lockwood was with me eft him on at Jefferson St. by W Hughs, Grocery: went home by roaday by where Meiller house was: didn't see Lockwood at all bef yesterday while alive: came in on the Olympian: after got home did not go out of the house: sat up about an hour when went to bed, and afterwards my wifes mother went to bed and blew out lights_ always been good friends with deceased and never had a word with him in the world never had words with anyone else regarding him and always considered him one of my most sinone friends: saw two lanterns on track and supposed it to be party returning from my house might have been some one else: am often out late when playing

Charls Walker recalled: qualify statement of this morning, by saying that couldn't tell that Mr Lockwood was intoxicated when he we left our house last night: qualified that statement this morning but you must have misunderstood me: always thought Mr Lockwood a sincno friend of mine & of our family new said anything against him" was about 3 or 4 p.m. when he was there last (at house) before coming to spend evening had a Canary bird with him & saw him depart- don't believe he would never have laid down on track if was not drunk: body was warm after I got to him and after he was run over: when drinking would get deathly sick vomiting etc.
Adjourned until Friday July 17th '85 at 1 p.m.
